website_summaries.verdict: Newly upgraded and quiet dog nail grinder that's best for small breeds and modest budgets.
pros: Small, light and easy to handle nail grinding tool that's value priced and super quiet
Pro tip: trim very long nails before grinding to save time
cons: Battery life only lasts long enough to do 4 paws on a small dog

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet nail grinder
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is so quiet, the dogs aren't afraid of it as they are the other grinders. It works well; a little slow as is fine so it takes off just a little at a time. But it is so nice not to have to "fight" and then give up with trimming the dogs' nails.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Just used it on my 70pound Boxer Gracie --The low noise let her tolerate it's use like none I've used before -clipping is fine but this does a better smoother job -you still have to take time and care to shape correctly and watch the quick But so far it's great I would recommend !Plus rechargeable ,great ! Photo of a pleased Gracie no stress no worries
customer_reviews.author: mightymo 81

customer_reviews.title: Definitely get for your pets.
customer_reviews.text: I have the pedipet it never quite worked right and now even with new batteries won't keep its momentum when spinning. It lags. So when I started shopping for other options I was surprised to find this nail grinder. I love that it's rechargeable with a standard micro USB. The grinder head is perfectly curved. It makes grinding my dogs nails so much easier and faster. And it is so quiet!!!! We have a German shepherd and a min pin who hated having their nails trimmed and they do not fight me on nail day anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Ash b33

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: My dog hightails it out of the room if I pull out the nail clippers and she doesn't put up that much of a fight when I pull this thing out. It is not very aggressive, so it takes some time to get each nail filed down, but that is perfect for my skittish girl. Just make sure not to push the nail down on to the final too hard, or the spinning mechanism will cease all together and until you let up on some of the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Hoot

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! My dogs wouldn't let me NEAR their feet with clippers. I introduced them slowly to this device, just touching a few nails to it and then giving them treats. Now they don't mind at all, treats aren't necessary, and I save a LOT of money by not having to take them to a groomer every time they needs their nails trimmed. One of my dogs has long cuticles and his nails grow right before my eyes. This also leaves a nice smooth edge to the nails, so if you have hardwood floors, so scratching. No replacement heads needed...just clean with a wet washcloth. I would recommend this to anyone that needs to deal with pet nail trimming!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Dornan

customer_reviews.title: WORTHLESS
customer_reviews.text: From the time I bought this up until today this thing has never held a charge long enough to file one paw. It was a complete waste of money and it hardly has enough power to work at all. Don’t bother with this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Misty M Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Best nail grinder I’ve bought so far!
customer_reviews.text: This nail grinder is amazing! I will not lie, my chihuahua was a bit afraid of it despite the low noise it creates. But after one day of positive reinforcement when introducing this nail grinder, my dog now is relaxed whenever it’s time for me to deal with her nails. My dog deals with anxiety and the other nail clippers traumatized her as well as the other nail grinders. However this nail grinder exceeded my expectations when grinding her nails! It does an amazing job! I can now stress free grind her nails while she doses off!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: This tool is pretty worthless. I have mini schnauzers and it doesn't make any effect on their nails. You would have to pre-clip the nails and then try and sand, and sand, and sand with this grinder to get the nail at least smoothed down. You don't want to hold it to the nail more then a couple seconds at a time as the nail heats up and that will hurt your pet. I would NOT recommend this nail groomer.
customer_reviews.author: Bets

customer_reviews.title: Works great - but battery doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Update: not even a year later and probably 20 uses, i am going to have to replace it. Maybe its only meant for tiny dogs...?? I did have this at 3 stars, but am now giving it 1 star. Need something to help file the dog's nails. I don't know if its just mine, but I have to keep it plugged into a portable USB in order to keep it running for more than a second. I plugged it in to charge for a while and it didn't matter. Since it has a long cord, the portable USB charger works great.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but does not work on nails for larger dogs (I have a german shepherd). The grinder simply would stop. Not powerful enough, but a great concept. Maybe this would work well with much smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.author: KathyP

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to receive my URPOWER. Packaging was perfect. When I turned it on I was surprised on how low the sound is. FYI just remember it's not fully charged. So you have to charge it. Once it was fully charged I was able to use it on my dog Nova. She was not even scared and let me do it with no problems. So far I am very happy with this product. Shipping was really fast. Thank you so much. I definitely will recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa V

customer_reviews.title: Was great, until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved using this nail grinder, but one day it just stopped working, out of the blue. He took it off the charger and...nothing. Before that, the only downside was it didn't hold much of a charge, he couldn't finish one (small) dog's nails on one charge, but he still liked the product. The search continues.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, efficient nail trimming!
customer_reviews.text: This little nail grinder is pleasant to use, both for the pet and pet owner. The new family puppy arrived with very sharp nails which scratched everyone who played with her. First we tried to trim her nails with a clipper, which only hurt her when we clipped too close to the quick. So, we ordered the URPOWER grinder, followed the directions to get her accustomed to the sound (which is very quite!) and then at play time we filed those little nails easily. It's best to have two people: one to hold the dog's paw and one to hold the grinder, but it isn't necessary, just easier. Charging the grinder worked perfectly as the instructions indicated.
customer_reviews.author: d. wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cats and dogs!!
customer_reviews.text: We have two cats and a dog and it is getting incredibly expensive to keep taking them to the vets for a nail trim. Thought this product would be a great idea bc it would do all animals....love this product !!!! Our dog has no problem with the sound (which is very soft) and he lets me do all nails- our cat did the same thing- could not believe they let us trim their nails. Still haven’t tried on one cat but I can’t imagine having any issues. For this price, this pet tool is fantastic and works really well. No more expensive vet nail trims!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M. Karaganov

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: First time using a pet nail grinder. Also was Used on a 4month old pup. I let him listen to it powered on and smell it etc, had some treats nearby gave lots positive reinforcement and after a few attempts he finally turned his head and let me finish the remaining nails. Runs QUIET, and very effective in smoothing his, clipped but jagged, nails. Easy to hold. The nail openings are a good size, so I'll be able to use this tool for a while. And the fact that it's rechargable is saving me the hassle of constantly buying batteries. Any new Info down the line will be updated to this review .
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Not super powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a starter grinder for my dog who hates his feet touched and also hates loud noises. It is very very quiet. It still takes two of us to hold and grind his nails. But this was a great start to desensitizing him to a grinder. It takes a long time to make any progress because its very small and not hugely powerful. And you have to keep switching nails so that they don't get too hot. But for the price, its doing the job ok. Not useful if you want to grind a lot off fast. We will likely move on to a more powerful one once my dog is used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Ursiejd

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life only lasts several uses
customer_reviews.text: I would give it less than a star if I could. I bought this to use on my Min pin and it worked fine until the battery stopped holding a charge. I legit only used it 4 times. I charged it correctly by draining the battery completely and charging it just until it was full. After the 3rd charge it started only lasting for a minute while it charged in 30 sec. Terrible battery life. I read other reviews of the same problem but i wanted to try it for myself. The other reviewers were right save your money. Get a grinder at Wal-Mart that way you can easily return it when the battery dies.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany s.

customer_reviews.title: So far the best
customer_reviews.text: Got it in the mail today if u are like me and scared of clippers and scared u will hurt your dog this is the product to get.. my dog hates anything that touches his nails and paws.. and I never wanted to do clip his nails so I woukd have a grommer do it because I was afriaid I may go to low and hurt my dog. Found this product and it's way easier and safer aswell as iam a first time cutter to my dogs nails .. hopefully it will last
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed expectations
customer_reviews.text: After a weeklong doggie daycare stay, they throw in a bath and trim the dog's nails. I've always used a simple dog nail file after trimming to tame the coarse bits, but was amazed at how smooth my dog's nails were after her daycare stay so I purchased this grinder. It was very quiet with no rattling on my dog's nails. She didn't give it a second glance. One charge was enough for the after-trimming smoothing out of the ends. And I believe the results were even better than at the groomer's. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and made trimming easy and quick
customer_reviews.text: Loved that the grinder charges so quick. What I like best is that it is very quiet so my pug, who is a rescue, didn't mind getting her nails trimmed. So much that she laid back in my lap while I did them. With other grinders she always fought with me. I just introduced her to the grinder and have her treats, as I always have, while trimming her nails. Now it's quick and easy. It's great that it's so small which makes it great to carry when traveling
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low noise, but bad battery, heats too quickly
customer_reviews.text: This grinder doesn't hold charge well at all. Yet each time it is plugged in, it thinks it is fully charged within minutes. You can leave it on the charger for 1-3 hours, and it still won't hold charge. The actual device was created in a way that it is not too difficult to maneuver while grinding a dog's nails, but it barely makes any headway on my dog's nails before it heats up and causes her discomfort. It is not loud, and she got used to the sound, even though she doesn't like her nails done. But an empty board can do the same thing as this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: pk123

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life makes using it a pain.
customer_reviews.text: The battery doesn’t last very long and if the charge is depleted any kind of pressure makes the grinding stone stop completely. Which would be fine if the cord were longer. I can’t sit in my couch and control the dog without pulling the charger out of the usb plug. I have to sit close to the outlet on the floor which isn’t really comfortable. Also it heats up pretty quickly when it’s plugged in and charging. So I basically have to stop about halfway through and let it charge and cool. It does work but once again the poor battery life makes using it inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Not today

customer_reviews.title: Mine must be broken
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because the reviews were favorable. Many of them saying that is powerful. Well, after a full charge, the unit grinds to a stop if I apply pressure to the nail of my pug. I guess this unit works wonder if you want to smooth out nails but it does not have power to actually grind them down.. Now my pug has nice long smooth nails, not exactly what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.author: Kman

customer_reviews.title: Great for skittish dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog loses her mind when she sees nail clippers and hides in her crate. This nail grinder is very quiet, has little vibration, and works quickly. I worked with her in the beginning with treats for every nail. Now she will sit patiently with me and get a treat once I'm completely done. Wear a mask when you use it, though. It produces a lot of dust. I had another trimmer awhile back where the nail dust was more contained and could be dumped. That's not the case for this one. Not a problem with a mask, but I worry about the dog breathing it in. Still haven't thought of a solution to that.
customer_reviews.author: unhootchie

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet and easy to use. It took away the anxiety of cutting too far and making my pet bleed. My dog was at first unsure about the little vibration of the device on her nails, but after one or two nails, I got comfortable with the angle that worked best and she calmed right down. There is a little plastic guard that fits onto the grinder that limits the exposure of the nail to the grinder. I didn't even use the guard and had no problem at all controlling the amount of nail affected. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sicknick

customer_reviews.title: Fast, quiet, easy to use, the dog is calm with this one
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous very quiet nail trimmer for my white "mini" poodle. Fast, easy, charges last. Big difference from a low line dremel I have been using that did not hold a charge very well and took much longer to do the job. Be aware this spins so fast the insert warms to lift the grinder every 5 seconds or so, and that is correct as far as I am concerned. A plus was the low, low price from Amazon. It's a keeper and if I had to buy a new one next year, I would not hesitate. Keep it in stock Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: julilyn3

customer_reviews.title: Works & Accepted by Pet
customer_reviews.text: As stated in other reviews, the unit operates quietly. It changes quickly and appears to have good operating time before requiring charging. I have only used the unit twice for 10-15 minutes. My dog is a 7 month old Cavalier King Charles. I am satisfied with the product. But, I have not had the unit long enough for a complete evaluation.
customer_reviews.author: John Bee

customer_reviews.title: Helps Get over trimming anxiety
customer_reviews.text: My Pom has always been scared and freaks out whenever its time to trim his nails. (I had cut too far once in the past :'( ) Even with his favorite treats, it's obvious he wants nothing to do with it. With this trimmer, he acted the same but towards the end he got settled once he saw that it wasn't hurting him and that it takes far less time. Im sure after a few more successful sessions, he will get over his fear. It's a machine, so there is a low hum to it. Hope this helps those in the same situation!
customer_reviews.author: JHarlow

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected, great nail grinder for dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and works just as stated. It’s fast and grinds the dogs nails down efficiently and quietly. It is easy to use and shapes the nails smoothly. The charges lasts quite a while too. My smaller dog was freaking out at first but once he realized it wouldn’t hurt him, he was fine. Using this pet nail grinder is MUCH better than clipping their nails because clipping splits the nails and increases the change of hitting the quick and making them bleed especially if they have black nails, it’s hard to tell where the quick ends. Anyway. I’m super happy with this purchase and the reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Must be plugged in if you want it to last 3 seconds.
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice. Needs to be plugged in to work. The motor/battery scenario is soooooo weak. Pretty disappointed honestly. I assume "URPOWER" means "NOPOWER" It does make a great conversation piece, as it does look like a vibrator!
customer_reviews.author: Estry

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Gave it one star since it quite, but it does not grind the nails very good its slow, dull and creates nail dust you breath which is nasty. It takes way to long which my dogs got irritated because I was holding there paws to long. The only use I see if after I cut them with a regular clipper is it might smooth the rough nails a tad. I have small dogs and there nails are not super thick so this item does not do good. I would return but it cost me 6.99 to return and thats just to much. I might use on own feet to grind calluses or something but for dogs its not sharp enough.
customer_reviews.author: cal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing performance for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this nail grinder. I am attaching a short video review but the gist of it is that this is a great product at a great price. Its rechargeable via micro-USB and small enough to be portable. Its also very quiet and doesn't scare my dogs or make them nervous while getting their nails trimmed. You really can't beat this thing for the price, it does everything I need it for!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Horn

customer_reviews.title: It works! And has lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for over a year (maybe two?) and use it every two weeks on my 45 pound dog. Love it. Being able to grind her nails down instead of clipping them has made both of us much less stressed about the process. The red low-battery warning comes on more often than it used to (after ~ two paws worth of nails), but the USB charger lets me recharge the device in just a few minutes. The grit of the grinder is still effective and I haven't noticed any decline in how well it works. Great product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Meesh

customer_reviews.title: Beagle approved! 2 paws up!
customer_reviews.text: My beagle hates having her nails clipped (I am also so scared of cutting them too short and hurting her) and loud noises. This little tool was perfect. This was quieter than the drill I have seen/heard being used for human nails at nail salons. It charger quickly and was easy to hold and handle. I used the smaller side of the file and was able to safely trim my dog's nails in less than 5 minutes and she didn't seem to hate it!
customer_reviews.author: Ekimberly

customer_reviews.title: VERY QUIET and VERY EFFECTIVE!
customer_reviews.text: My tiny (4 lb) toy dogs love this Nail Grinder. I slowly got them use the the very quiet sound, turning it on (with the cap on) and letting them smell it and feel it on their back tummy, feet, etc, over the period of a week. Slowly I tried to grind 1 nail... then the next day 2... then a whole paw. EASY! They don't mind it at all, and they have become very comfortable with the grinder. It is VERY QUIET!, and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: Charges very easily. I use this on my scardy cat-Yorkshire dog
customer_reviews.text: Charges very easily. I use this on my scardy cat-Yorkshire dog. He hates getting his nails trimmed and grinded. Helps me grind my 10lb dog's nails easily. I have to bribe my dog with treats after every nail grind. That's a lot of treats!! This has some noise, but it's manageable. It's a great price for the ease of doing this at home. I like how it's cordless and easy to use. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SuperShopper202

customer_reviews.title: I have used it several times ...
customer_reviews.text: This is OK for my large Yorkie. I have used it several times. I have watched YouTube videos to learn how to use this. They helped a lot. I still found it as just OK. I'm looking for something else. This is an edited version of what I first wrote. After writing this I was giving myself a pedicure and saw the grinder. Voila. I can use it to spruce up my toenails. I also discovered I could use it to smooth calluses around my nails and heals. Painless and fast. Much better than on my dogs nails. Now I kind of like this, a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Holle

customer_reviews.title: A good product, but unfeasible for medium dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to be clear that this is a pretty good product by the standards of production quality. I simply want to make one thing clear: This is a stretch for medium dogs. Being the owner of a 28 pound sheltie, I certainly can, and did, grind her nails with this device. But it will take you hours. If you have a small breed dog, I think this would be an advisable purchase. However, if your dog is not comfortably under twenty pounds, I would suggest you look to more powerful dremel options.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Rarely do I write bad reviews, but this product stopped recharging after second use. Now trying dremel instead. This was a complete waste of money and time, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Petra

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Hold A Charge After Using Just A Few Times
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is a piece of junk. Definitely not for large dogs. Would probably work on smaller dogs, though for cats the noise would scare the bejesus out of them. I wouldn't want to be the one holding the cat with long nails. After using just a couple of times, the battery will not charge. Light immediately goes to green after plugging it in. Unplug and turn it on; dead. Don't waste your money. Buy a Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Heape

customer_reviews.title: quiet and has a nice design but it's useless after ~5 uses
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for the first couple of uses. Now, it barely holds a charge. When I do charge it, the charging indicator turns green from red in less than 10 min. And when I try to use it, the battery dies in less than 5 min. The results are the same when I charge it for 1-2 hrs. And I can't use it while charging because it overheats really quickly. All my dogs have black nails making it a little scary for me to clip their nails, which is why I wanted to try a nail grinder. But this was not worth it. It's cheap, quiet and has a nice design but it's useless after ~5 uses.
customer_reviews.author: sy

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have used other dog nail grinders before, but after a few times something happens to them. Usually the grinder head breaks or the motor gives out. I love this dog nail grinder. It's blvery easy to use and clean. It recharges very quickly. The grinder head does a great job. It usually takes two people to cut my dogs nails. One to hold him still and the other to trim his nails. But with this grinder I don't have to have two people. It's very quiet and he doesn't seem to mind it at all. He fell asleep on me last time. So I highly recommend buying this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: bryan spears

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't sure what to expect...
customer_reviews.text: After ready reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. I'm glad I took a leap of faith and decided to try this nail trimmer. I have a Pomeranian that is scared of everything and she did not mind me cutting her nails with this trimmer. She is black and so are her nails, so it's hard to tell where the quik is. I cut her nails without incident using this trimmer! I highly recommend it. Her nails turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: My Reviews

customer_reviews.title: incredible product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for dog and it worked perfect. No struggles with dog. No more worrying about cutting dogs nails to short. Then I bought one for myself. really easy to use on toe nails. Then for Christmas I bought one for my mother who paid for toe nail trims once a month (cost of $75) and she uses this for her self. No more fees. Also bought one for a friend who loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this nail grinder. It is rechargeable, so I always get the power I need to trim my dogs nails. It is easy to handle and quiet. I have a 14 year old Lab. I have never have had to trim her nails because she was so active. However with age, she has slowed down. She tolerates this grinder easily and I think the shorter nails help ease her paw pain. Since it is rechargeable, I am doing just a bit every day, till I get the nails back to where they need to be. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne B. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this as nail clipping is not a fun time around our house for our Aussie, but this is worthless. It takes so much more time and patience (for both the dog AND owner) to trim down a nail with this tool than to clip it. It is also noisy which our pup did NOT enjoy, so it didn't win any points there either. Wish I hadn't spent the money... this will go in the donate pile.
customer_reviews.author: amd92

customer_reviews.title: I take out the nail cutters and my poor lil pooch will run behind my couch and hide
customer_reviews.text: Any dog owner would know the troubles of trimming nails, especially with nail cutters. I take out the nail cutters and my poor lil pooch will run behind my couch and hide. NOT ANYMORE!! This nail grinder from URPOWER is perfect. Quite, light weight, and chargeable! As soon as it arrived, I had my dog sniff it, I turned it on and started grinding away. She did not move at all. I never thought the day ill be able to do my dogs nails in peace would come. Would definitely recommend this to other buyers and new dog owners.
customer_reviews.author: ronnel bautista

customer_reviews.title: All great except perhpas the price
customer_reviews.text: Our little 3 1/2 pound Yorkie is terrorized about having her nails filed...and we, the parents, are novices . The 1st night we did it was NOT a pretty picture! LOL The device is quiet...and we will get better. Our plan is to file every week so we can accomplish the task in a quicker manner. I certainly believe this file/grinder is more animal friendly than clippers. My only complaint is the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn In Houston, TXTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Both pups have nice nails with no fear
customer_reviews.text: I have dachshunds with their little bitty paws. Every time we would try to clip their nails, they were scared. One had been clipped too close before and was upset every time we tried to clip. Got this handy tool and neither are scared anymore!! It hardly makes any noise. Both pups have nice nails with no fear!
customer_reviews.author: joshsmom1996

customer_reviews.title: Good but short lived
customer_reviews.text: My husky hates having her nails trimmed and always jerks away her paws so I’m horrified of hurting her in the process. I thought this would be helpful. It creates a bit of a mess but I’ll take that over hurting my little girl any day. I used this about 6 time and it stopped working. It shows it’s fully charged and turns on but as soon as any pressure hits the file it stops spinning. Need to look for a similar product because it was awesome when it functioned properly
customer_reviews.author: teezy

customer_reviews.title: Great for squirmy pups!
customer_reviews.text: We got this because our 4 month old puppy was really squirmy with regular trimmers. This grinder is wonderful - if the puppy squirms, it won't hurt his paw or risk cutting him too short! It rounds out the edges of his little demon claws so that not only are they a safe length, but they won't scratch up our legs when he lays with us. It takes a bit of time to get his claws to the appropriate length, but if you are patient then this tool really makes puppy-manicure time so much easier and safer. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!!! Not sure how I lived without it!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today so I have no idea how they hold up, but this is beyond amazing. I bought an expensive dremmel a while back and my cocker spaniels fur on her feet can easily get caught in it. This has a guard so that can’t happen. It is so quiet and doesn’t really even vibrate a crazy amount. My cocker didn’t mind and it even worked fine for my 65lb lab pup.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Rieckens

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Quiet and efficient. I have a small german shepherd mix and I really just need it for his declaws that don't get worn down by walking outside. I was a little worried since this is mainly for small dogs but it worked just as well on his thicker nails. And I don't have to worry about cutting him using clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstyn

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet!
customer_reviews.text: This nail grinder is quiet and very easy to use. I love that I could use it right away (plugged in) and can't wait to use it unplugged to see if it runs just as well. My puppy was afraid, but only because it was her first time having he nails ground.
customer_reviews.author: Greeneyes

customer_reviews.title: Works Great...Happy Dog
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with the description and product details. Great price and it works great! Very happy with it and my dog is happy too! My dog hates to have her nails cut and I always have to take her to the Vet to have them done. But, with this grinder, she allowed me to grind them and we are all happy! Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Richmond

customer_reviews.title: This is great. It's super easy to use and it's very ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great. It's super easy to use and it's very quiet, especially if your pooch is a nervous little guy. I was kinda disappointed by there not being an actual charger, but I realized that it's 2017 and everyone has a USB-port charger. I would definitely recommend this to anyone with pets that they need to get their claws in control.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My two puppy labs were (are) not fans of the original clippers where you have to insert their nails into the cutter and try not to cut the quick. I received this dremel on Monday and it was fantastic! Very
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Can’t clip your dog’s nails ? This is your solution!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this!!! I have a Chihuahua/Pomeranian mix who is afraid of everything!!! Clipping his nails became almost impossible - we had to muzzle him and he still clawed up my husband's arms if he tried to hold him when I clipped them. I purchased this in January and would turn it on and let him sniff it while he was laying on the couch. Eventually, I just sat him in my lap and used them on him! No fighting me!!! He was very calm and it didn't seem to cause him any stress - I can't thank you enough for this product!
customer_reviews.author: Diane M. Shea

customer_reviews.title: great upgrade on the pet grooming tools
customer_reviews.text: Needed a nail grinder for my cat's back paws. Those things quickly become talons and at times its hard to tell the nail from the quick. So a grinder is a great way to be safe about it. The URPOWER tool is smaller and quieter than electronic nail files I've used in the past. Plus, it conveniently charges with the standard USB cord you already use. Love this product and highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: nicer than clipping
customer_reviews.text: This is easier to use and more pleasant for my dogs. Even though I've never cut the quick they still were nervous about having their nails cut. Now I just grind each nail for a few seconds at a time, moving from nail to nail, so they don't get hot, and pop a small tidbit into my dogs mouth every once in awhile as they lie there, and they come to like manicure time.
customer_reviews.author: Brillig

customer_reviews.title: Good product , would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of having to buy batteries and new cartridges for our old Pedi-paw so I gave this a shot. I was really close to sending this back because I was surprised at how quickly the battery died. The device is somewhat confusing with the charge indicator, there's no way to tell how full the battery is. After charging for 12 hrs I tried it again and it works like a dream! I appreciate the different nail settings, and I love how the trimmer is curved slightly so I don't need to do any shaping. I take 1 star off because it does not include a charging cable, and it needs to be recharged between every single use.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Rose

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet, best for small or medium sized dogs
customer_reviews.text: Especially for the price, this is a wonderful product. I have standard poodles in the 40-45 lb range. This just barely makes the cut. I would highly recommend it for smaller dogs but it definitely won't be powerful enough for larger dogs or dogs with large nails. Biggest pro is how quiet it is compared to other more powerful dremmels I have used.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Using this on chicken toe nails
customer_reviews.text: The grinder works just fine but is not rough enough to grind down chicken toenails. But I found out that it works wonderfully to polish off sharp corners after I clip the nails. The chickens would not sit still long enough to grind down the nails but they don't mind getting the sharp edges polished off. If this unit wears out would I purchase another to replace it - sure would!
customer_reviews.author: June Schwierjohn

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE BATTERY DONT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was an excellent product until I started actually grinding the nails. It is quiet as the reviews say, however to grind my dogs nails I must charge it every paw. Starts blinking red within 30 seconds, charge it until the green indicator shows charged, get 30 seconds and then repeat. Very disappointed in this products battery. Don’t buy if you want to cut nails in a timely manner, but if you have all day this product is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: he seems fine with it
customer_reviews.text: I just tried it on our dog, he seems fine with it! Usually, when I cut his nails, he hates it, but when I did his nails with this, he just stood there and let me do them! Also, I was told, that their nails don't bleed as easy with these( I don't know if it's true, but I always seem to cut 1 nail too short, which really upsets me)!
customer_reviews.author: KAREN S. BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Works great for small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This is much quieter than pedipaws. I used to have to fight to trim my ratchas claws. With this product she still doesn't like getting her manipedi but when she gets settled in to it she just ignores what I'm doing and watches the cat do her swatkitty stuff.
customer_reviews.author: william kennison

customer_reviews.title: This nail grinder is TERRIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: I literally just bought this nail grinder in October, and only TWO uses later and the charge on it is so weak that it cant even grind my 5lb chihuahuas nails anymore, so I had to buy a new one from a different company that works WAY better. And since its two months later, they wont even refund my money back. I am very unhappy with this product and this company because the grinding capabilities are seriously so weak. Like I put my dogs nail on it and barely touch the grinder with her nail and the grinder stops because it is so weak. I do not recommend, look for a better one.
customer_reviews.author: John Daratony

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. I like that it's usb charging instead of eating up Batteries. It packs up neatly with the charge cord in its little box, which is nice. I wouldn't say it's easier than using clippers. There's less of a fight with the dogs using this grinder, but it takes much longer than using clippers do. I recommend using with a dust mask so you're not breathing in burnt nail dust that kicks up. Overall great product, great price, very easy to use. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Van Alstyne

customer_reviews.title: While described as a grinder, it more of a medium weight nail file
customer_reviews.text: This works well for filing more so than grinding down the nails. Our pup is pretty patient when using this but wish the wheel was a bit more abrasive. We use this often but it is not enough to keep up with the nail growth and eventually have to use the clippers. This works well to file and smooth the nails after clipping. With often use, clippers may not be needed. We just can't seem to keep up with our pups nails using this alone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: They are very quiet but for me it was just easier to clip the nail quickly than to try and hold their paw and position this and then hold long enough to file the nail down to the same amount that could be clipped quickly.
customer_reviews.author: ABuyer69

customer_reviews.title: I believe this grinder will save a lot of cat claws into my fine Corinthian leather seats
customer_reviews.text: Both our kitten and dog took to having their claws ground without any major problem. I was surprised. It is not REALLY quiet but quiet enough so its operation does not scare the animals. I believe this grinder will save a lot of cat claws into my fine Corinthian leather seats.
customer_reviews.author: ZENITH

customer_reviews.title: Not cutting it (literally)
customer_reviews.text: If you wanted to file all of a dog's nails, you would be working for a few hours. This is really only recommended for cat nails or REALLY small dogs. We have an 11 lbs Cocker Spaniel and it was excruciatingly slow on her, but I really gave up when it came to our 45-pounders. Go get a Dremel from the home improvement section instead.
customer_reviews.author: Sanny

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to use/
customer_reviews.text: This pet nail grinder is ok, the motor is not as strong as I would like. I have a 45 lb black lab and the grinder does an OK job as long as not much pressure is added. My dog did fine the very first time I used it on her. I would pet her and just touch the grinder to her nail for a second or two. Then I would stop and restart making the grinding time a few seconds longer. I would say this product would be great for small dogs with very small nails. Its OK for my size dog and I do not intended on buying anything different until this one stops working.
customer_reviews.author: G&M

customer_reviews.title: Quite and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have two rabbits and clipping never goes well. I got this in hopes I might be able to stay on top of their nails a bit better. They actually don’t mind me using this on them: it’s quite, and decent speed. Almost wish it was faster so it was easier to use as a single person holding a rabbit, but overall it works very well and is a great price, I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Cadey

customer_reviews.title: Returned doesn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT grind. Although it appears to be functioning as well as it can and it looks nice, the Motor on this model is way too weak. Even slight pressure from my own fingernail is enough to stop the head spinning. If you hold it lightly against the nail (like feather lightly) you might make a mark after a few seconds. This is at Full charge. If it had a more powerful motor it might have been serviceable but I'll never know. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, its a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by agreeing that this pet nail grinder is truly amazing. My old english bulldogs are terrified of just about everything but this grinder is so quiet that they didn't seem to be bothered at all by the task. The only thing that kept me from giving it 5 stars is that it does have to be recharged fairly soon after use in one paw. Keep in mind they needed some serious trimming. For the price and the comfort my dogs felt when using it, I would absolutely buy this again and I recommend it to anyone with large pets.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Received the nail grinder sooner than expected. I think it's the perfect size, very easy to grip and handle. So far it's very quiet. My miniature Doxie still won't let me use it on her but she just went blind in the past couple of months so she is weary of a lot of things. I don't expect to have any problem with my other fur babies. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Mildred J. Vansant

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried this with my dog once, and I think it's a good product. He hates anyone touching his feet though, so I can't really comment at how easy it is to use :). I will say that I was able to get him to calm down eventually and let me work on his nails, which is something I wasn't able to do with clippers. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a nail grinder for sure.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great for shifty/scared dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog is absolute nut job about getting his nails cut and this grinder is the answer to my prayers. It took a little while for him to get used to the noise, and he still sometimes tries to lick it to make it go away, but once you get going, he actually allows me to grind his nails. My only complaint (and it's super minor) is that it requires frequent charging. I hope this never dies, but when it does, I will buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller and quieter than my previous nail grinder. I've only used it once so far on my 5 dogs, I will update this if I experience any issues. I do wish it had a stronger/ heavier grit option, a couple of my dogs have VERY hard nails and it takes a while to grind, but I love that I won't be burning through batteries! AND it came fully charged, which was greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: USB is convenient, must keep charged!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grinder because of the USB feature for charging. The previous one I owned required batteries which did not last long. This products performs as it should. I like the USB charging, but you must charge it prior to every use. For upkeep, it will stay charged long enough for all four paws, but for a heavy duty job it only make it through two paws. I like that you don't have to replace the stone, unlike the other model I had that required changing sandpaper.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Lockman

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price, and Great Service!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this product and the great customer service! My order actually arrived several days earlier than my original delivery date! Thank you!! The product works wonderful on my terrier-poodle's nails! It's super quiet so it was super easy for our Sadie to get use to! Super pleased all the way around!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Harris

customer_reviews.title: Files too slow but comfortable use
customer_reviews.text: It is small and sleek, very light weight. It fits perfectly in you're hand and is comfortable to use. It is unfortunate that it works so slowly, it takes at least 5 minutes to finish a single nail. Another issue is that there's no mechanism to help keep the nail dust from flying everywhere, which wouldn't be as much of an issue if it didnt take so long to file down a single nail. I would recommend if you have a lot of time to spare to groom your pet, and if you're in a well ventilated space.
customer_reviews.author: Angie K

customer_reviews.title: She isn't super excited about it however does not pull her paw ...
customer_reviews.text: My pup has nails of steel. She hates the sound of clippers. I can successfully clip her back paws while she sleeps but her front paws never. This gadget does the job, slowly but eventually. She isn't super excited about it however does not pull her paw away long enough for me to make small progress. I think this gadget would be awesome for smaller dogs and animals or animals with softer nails ( my girl is an APBT ) An actual dremel drill would probably work faster in my case.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, poor battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I have an 18lb pug-mix with thick, fast-growing claws and a lot of anxiety about leaving the house for a nail trim, so I bought this. It does run quiet, with minimal vibration, the guard over the grinding head is good for safety, and like the heading says, it gets the job done. But not even all the way through grinding ONE nail, the battery indicator light went from green to flashing red. I could feel it slowing down and losing power and effectiveness. So if you have the patience to grind one claw at a time while letting the thing charge in between, then this is the grinder for you.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Item is Great
customer_reviews.text: As far as electric grinders go- this one is good. It's fairly quiet, compact, and works great. My dog doesn't love it- but he's not afraid of it either. Takes a few tries to get the angle right on the nail, but the item itself is great. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Rassi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a neurotic puppy
customer_reviews.text: My dog, a Beagle Welch Corgi mix, HATES having her claws trimmed. She yelps at the sight of claw trimmers. She was unsure of the nail grinder at first, but she tolerates it. lol It tickles like crazy so we had to trim her over-long claws in shifts. Poor girl. lol She much prefers this over claw clippers, any day.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Fisk

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nicely made device
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nicely made device, high quality. It is easy to use and very quite . Our cats do not seem to mind it at all. Thank you for making a very nice, easy ,High quality Device at a reasonable price. John Mehl....
customer_reviews.author: John Mehl

customer_reviews.title: The dog loves it. Give treats in the process and your pet will look forward to grooming
customer_reviews.text: The dog loves it. Spend a few days starting it up around your dogs before you go after nails. Rubs her back with it. let her sniff it and get used to sound ) it is not loud) Give a small treat after every nail or three and your pet will see it as a GOOD thing not a grooming this.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Owens

customer_reviews.title: More quiet than I had expected!
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use and I feel it is safer than trying to clip the solid black nails of my little 7-lb chihuahua mix. She doesn't seem to mind it and it is more quiet than I had expected it to be. The price was lower than most of the others that were available and I was pleasantly surprised of the quality for the money spent. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DeeCee

customer_reviews.title: Works but requires patient
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is really quiet and does a nice trimming job. The only down side to this trimmer is the battery. It does not last long for big dogs and will require to be charged constantly. It also gets hot and will blink red and not work as well.
customer_reviews.author: Benji

customer_reviews.title: Dog preferred this over clippers but the grinder stopped holding a charge
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because our dog was terrified of nail clippers and I thought grinding his nails might not upset him as much. I was happy to see that this nail grinder didn’t seem to bother him at all and it did a pretty good job. It was a little slow to grind but it was quiet. My reason for the low stars is that it stopped holding a charge after a year. I was glad to get a lot of use out of it for the year it worked, but I was hoping it would have lasted longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: Monica S.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet but I wouldn't buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend it. It is a quiet grinder but mine doesn't want to charge. I have gotten it to charge once and that is it. It's supposed to have either a red or green light on whenever it's plugged in but my light stays off. It also is not very powerful. I use it on my cats and mine seems to wear down the nail at a slow pace, even when I change the angle several times. The only good thing about the one I bought is that it is quiet and does not scare my cats.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I love that about it
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I didn't have high expectations. I was very surprise. Not sure how large dogs nails would do. But for the little dogs this is the ticket. VERY quiet. I love that about it. I really can only do one dogs nails and then it really needs to charge. I wish the battery lasted longer. I am working on doing a little trimming ever 2 days to get the nails back down where they need to be.
customer_reviews.author: Meows2002

customer_reviews.title: It works but battery is the issue
customer_reviews.text: Works well and my dog is not afraid of it as nail clips. Only issue is the battery. I saw those good reviews and decided to ignore the views criticizing the battery issue. And it did happen. I can only use it for less than 2 mins after each fully charge. Weird thing is it will show red when using it but when connected to the charger, it turns to green immediately. Has no idea whether it has battery or not. But generally speaking expect battery issues , it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnie

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you can get your dog to sit still
customer_reviews.text: I like this product except for one reason. It leaves the nails really sharp! It is quiet and easy to hold. Easier than getting your dog to sit still while you do it. Overall I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nancie

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: I finally had a chance to use my dog nail grinder and it went very well. My Chi-mix doesn't like his nails cut with a nail sniper but with this grinder he relaxed and let me do them. It is very quiet and doesn't vibrate so there was nothing to bother my dog. I wish I'd have gotten something like this long ago sure has have made grooming nails drama free.
customer_reviews.author: wfojon

customer_reviews.title: So much better than clippers
customer_reviews.text: Very slick, small, and comfortable. Super quiet. One of my dogs is not a fan of any electrical noises, and he was fine when I used it on him. The other dog is very fidgety, but tolerated the treatment like a champ. It has easy instructions on how to use, charge, and clean. I like that it has no cords and no batteries. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: QUIET!
customer_reviews.text: Wow... very quiet! Just got it in mail, got it fully charged, and next step will be to use for its intended use: do the pups nails. I have already tried it first on my own nails, and found it to be extremely quiet and you hardly notice it running. A true need for my pups. Looks to be a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Fredsmom

customer_reviews.title: Battery or motor issues
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 years or so and eventually stopped holding a charge, which was fine as I could keep the device plugged in and grind nails. But now for some reason even when plugged in the grinder isn't giving me enough power to use it. Will be looking for a different brand to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: B Coyle

product_meta.title: URPOWER Rechargeable Pet Nail Grinder Upgraded USB Charging Nail Trimmer Clipper Gentle Paws for Dogs Cats and Other Small & Medium Pets
product_meta.description:
How to get your pet used to nail handling? 
Clipping your pet’s nails can be a tense and sometimes painful experience for them, and for you. 
First, show him the nail grinder and let him sniff it while it is turned off. Then, turn it on so he can get used to the sound it makes. Have him sit while the tool is running in your hand. Give him positive reinforcement. Once he is used to the tool, try touching it to his nails. If he's not ready, you may need to repeat the above steps a few times.

Tips
If it is the first time for the pet to use nail grinder, it is recommended that the sharp fingernail or long wear parts should be grinded firstly, but not too much, avoid causing bleeding. 
For pet's safety, it should not be more than 5 seconds for one lasting time, and be aware to adjust the grooming angle to polish pet nails.

How to use 
Step 1: Charge this nail grinder with USB for almost 2 hours.
Step 2: According to the pet's size and characteristics of their nails, choose the suitable port for your pet. 
Step 3: Holding the grinder with one of your hands, holding the pet pads with the other hand, put its nail into a port gently, and then begin to grind.
Step 4: Take off the plastic cover the grinder in an anticlockwise direction, turn it on and gently clean the surface of the nail grinder with eraser, paper or cloth to remove the nail powder.

Specification 
Charging time: 2 hours
Running time: 3 hours
Input: AC100V-240V 50HZ/60HZ
Output: 5V/350MA
Package size: 7.55”*3.26”*1.18”
Package weight: 5.95oz

Package contents 
1x pet nail grinder
1x USB charging cord
1x user manual
feature_bullets: Upgraded version - Designed to be rechargeable by USB with indicator light make it more convenient and free you from changing batteries that often. Once being fully charged, the grinder will be well-performed over 3 hours in continously work.

Diamond grinding stone - Constructed with diamond bit grinder which is safer and more effective than nail clipper to trim pet nails, no replacements needed and powerful enough to trim your pets' nail in a short time.
Quiet and safe - Using super mute motor, brass shaft, unique mute technology, gently remove thin layers of nail with a soft sound. Pets will not be afraid any longer.

Applicable for small sized and medium sized pets - The pet nail trimmer has three ports for different sized nails. You can choose a suitable one according to the pets' size and characteristics of their nails.
Easy to clean: easy to remove the safe guard cap and nail Grinder Stone and then wipe them with a damp cloth.
